elements.description:
`<sc-scroll target=[[myid]]></sc-scroll>` scrolls the element with id `myid` into view.
<cs-scroll> and the element with `myid` have to be contained in `<sc-scroll>`s parent element.
### Example:
This allows you to implement same page routing in an app's shell elements shadow dom:

```
  <app-location route="{{route}}" use-hash-as-path></app-location>
  <app-route    route="{{route}}"
                pattern=":id"
                data="{{data}}" >
  </app-route>
  
  <cs-scroll target="{{data.id}}"></cs-scroll>
```

properties.name: target
properties.description: Id of the element that is scrolled into view

properties.name: _status
properties.description:
status used for errorhandling. Set by private method `_jumpToId()`.  
Values: 
- `found_target`: target is set to an elements id that was found and scrolled ito view
- `no_target`:  target is empty
- `wrong_target`: target is set to an id that was not found

methods.name: _jumpToId
methods.description: scrolls element with id `this.target` into view using its `scrollIntoView()` method.
